story:
Once upon a time, in a small village in India, there was a young girl named Meera. Meera was a kind and curious child who loved to learn about the world around her. She was particularly interested in the stories of the gods and goddesses that her mother would tell her before bedtime.

One night, Meera’s mother told her the story of Saraswati, the goddess of wisdom, music, and art. Saraswati was said to be so wise and knowledgeable that she could answer any question asked of her.

Meera was fascinated by this story and begged her mother to teach her more about Saraswati. Her mother agreed and began to teach Meera about the goddess’s many talents and virtues.

As Meera learned more about Saraswati, she became more and more determined to become just like her. She practiced her reading and writing every day, and soon she became the top student in her class. She also begged her parents for a veena, a traditional Indian stringed instrument, so that she could learn to play music like Saraswati.

Eventually, Meera’s parents bought her a veena, and she began to practice every day. She was a natural musician, and soon she was able to play beautiful melodies that filled the hearts of all who heard them with joy and peace.

As Meera grew older, she continued to study and practice, and she became known throughout the village as a wise and talented young woman. She was respected and admired by all, and she always made sure to use her knowledge and talents to help those around her.

One day, a great sage came to the village, and he was amazed by Meera’s wisdom and talent. He asked her how she had become so knowledgeable and skilled, and Meera told him about her love for Saraswati and her dedication to studying and practicing.

The sage was so impressed that he asked Meera to come with him to his ashram, where she could continue her studies and share her knowledge with others. Meera was overjoyed at the opportunity and eagerly agreed.

At the ashram, Meera continued to learn and grow, and she became a respected teacher and scholar. She spent the rest of her life sharing her knowledge and talents with others, and she was always remembered as a shining example of wisdom, music, and art.

And so, Meera’s story teaches us that with dedication and hard work, we can all become like Saraswati, the goddess of wisdom, music, and art. May you too dream big and work hard to achieve your goals, just like Meera.

Now, it's time to close your eyes and go to sleep. May the blessings of Saraswati be with you, and may you always be filled with wisdom, music, and art in your dreams and in your waking life. Good night, my dear daughter.
